Subject: Is junit-dep supposed to work without Hamcrest?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=316799131; y=KOxgH1BAsgpJ_mdSMWjakTv4LeJLHh_3ypOT_SiQlgGm1Z0
X-Yahoo-Profile: pniederw
X-eGroups-Approved-By: spchappell <simonpeterchappell@...> via web; 24 Oct 2010 11:13:24 -0000

Now that recent versions of junit-dep are finally available from Maven Cent=
ral, I've tried to replace junit with junit-dep (4.8.2) in my project. The =
idea is to allow users of my project to use later versions of Hamcrest if t=
hey want to. However, after this change I get NoClassDefFoundError: org/ham=
crest/SelfDescribing when calling org.junit.runner.Request.classes (see sta=
cktrace below). Therefore my question is: Should junit-dep work without Ham=
crest (as long as no Hamcrest-specific functionality is used)? And if yes, =
is there an unintentional dependency somewhere?

Cheers,
Peter
